intro: Malleastrum acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed malleastrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves with a pointed tip. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
